trans-unit.source: Specifies the bullet styles you can apply to list items in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletStyle> enumeration represents the bullet styles that you can apply to the list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property uses these enumeration values to set the bullet styles in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.

For example, if you set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletStyle%2A> property to `Disc`, each list item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control will render a filled circle preceding the content of the list item as follows:
List Item 1
List Item 2
List Item 3
Specifying the `CustomImage` bullet style allows you to supply your own image for the bullet.
If you specify the `CustomImage` bullet style, you must also set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList.BulletImageUrl%2A> property to the URL of the custom image to use.
If you specify `NotSet`, the browser in which the control is rendered will determine the bullet style to display with the list items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control.
The bullet style is an empty circle shape.
The bullet style is a custom image.
The bullet style is a filled circle shape.
The bullet style is a lowercase letter (a, b, c, ...).
The bullet style is a lowercase Roman numeral (i, ii, iii, ...).
The bullet style is not set.
The browser that renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> control will determine the bullet style to display.
The bullet style is a number (1, 2, 3, ...).
The bullet style is a filled square shape.
The bullet style is an uppercase letter (A, B, C, ...).
The bullet style is an uppercase Roman numeral (I, II, III, ...).
